intro: Iria microcarya, commonly known as the small-fruited iria, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs. Iria microcarya is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
